applicant_types: Registered charities; Community/voluntary groups; Community Interest Companies (CICs); Town/Parish Councils; Community Benefit Societies
geographic_scope: West of England (Bristol, Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire)
beneficiary_focus: Disadvantaged communities; People in need of support; Vulnerable people; Community wellbeing; Mental health; Poverty; Education; Youth services
funding_range: Up to £500,000 (most grants awarded to organisations with income under £500,000; individual grant sizes not always specified, but endowment and flow-through funds range from under £25,000 to £500,000+)
restrictions: Applicants must be based and working in the West of England (Bristol, Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire); No funding for medical research, equipment or treatment; No funding for activities/statutory services the government is responsible for; No funding for privately owned or profit-distributing companies; No funding for sports or arts projects without a community/charitable element; No funding for activities intended to influence religious choices or support political parties
deadline: None stated (rolling programmes, but individual grant deadlines may apply)
notes: ellenor Hospice is outside the Quartet Community Foundation's geographic scope (Kent vs. West of England). National charities may apply only if they have a base and significant local presence in the West of England and the grant benefits local people.
evidence: Quartet Community Foundation only funds organisations 'based and working in the West of England (Bristol, Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire)'. ellenor Hospice is based in Gravesend, Kent, and serves Dartford, Gravesham, Swanley, and Bexley, which are not within the West of England. While registered charities are eligible and the beneficiary focus is broadly relevant, the explicit geographic restriction excludes Kent-based organisations. The FAQs confirm that national charities must have a base and significant local presence in the West of England, which ellenor does not. Therefore, ellenor Hospice is not eligible for Quartet Community Foundation funding.
